aspace_helpers.title: we need a report of the hard-coded access notes in ACLU that diverge from their ancestor notes

comments.body: The logic should be: any aggregate-level restriction notes that differ from their child notes should be flagged
Further logic tweak: do not include leaf components with blank notes; do not include the collection level.

```
#when level (column G) is 0 (collection), do nothing
=IF(G3=0,"", 
#otherwise, if I is blank, flag it as missing the required attribute (these are migration artifacts)
    IF(AND(I3="", J3<>""), "missing required type attribute", 
        #otherwise, if level is smaller than the next row's (i.e. it's an aggregate) 
        IF(G3<G4, 
            # check that value of I is the same until level of G decreases by one
            IF(OR(AND(I3="", J3=""), INDEX(FILTER(I4:I$55096,G4:G$55096>G3),SEQUENCE(1,1,1,1))="", INDEX(FILTER(I4:I$55096,G4:G$55096>G3),SEQUENCE(1,1,1,1))=I3, "", 
           # otherwise, flag as type discrepancy
           "type discrepancy"), 
        #otherwise, if G is the same level as previous, grab flag from previous
#otherwise don't flag
IF(AND(G3=G2, AND(I2<>"", J2<>"")), M2, ""))))
```

cicognara-rails.title: Reindex to see if missing objects show up

comments.body:
### Tried so far

- With @rladdusaw, creating an app using the [initializr](https://start.spring.io/)
- Creating a new route
    - creating a MVCC test to assert that we get a 200 status response
    - authorizing anonymous users to access it with a `SecurityFilterChain`
    - accepting a parameter through RequestParam
- Use VSCode's very pleasant TDD experience to write tests (JUnit and Mockito), then implement the features.
- Use [Solrj documentation](https://solr.apache.org/guide/8_4/using-solrj.html#querying-in-solrj) to communicate with Solr.
- With @christinach, use checkstyle to lint the code (and attempt to configure it -- we didn't quite figure that out)
- Use semgrep and bearer SAST tools.  Both were green -- not sure if there are problems they should have found ðŸ˜œ
- Tried enabling CodeQL in the Github UI, but it failed complaining about the Java version.

### Answered questions

- Regular Spring or Reactive?  Best to use regular Spring, for each of troubleshooting, testing.
- Gradle or Maven? Maven, since we have experience on our team
Demo application at [pulibrary/bento_search_spring_experiment](https://github.com/pulibrary/bento_search_spring_experiment)

Questions from building:
1. How do we want to handle empty searches? They tend to take a long time and don't necessarily give much user value (although I confess I use them all the time in testing)
2. If available, should we include a "score"? It strikes me that this would be helpful in the types of integrations Jon and EsmÃ© suggested (so, if you're on the Catalog, but your search turns up records with very high scores from the maps application, that's when you could suggest the user might want to go there)

Add links to children of SubGuideCards
Display child SubGuideCards on SubGuideCard show page

comments.body:
In the rails console `rails c`:

Querying `SubGuideCard.where(heading: "Manuscripts (info)")` returns 
```
  id: 1626,
  heading: "Manuscripts (info)",
  sortid: "51626.5",
  parentid: "2870.5",
  path: "info/FF",
```

Another example: 
`SubGuideCard.where(heading: "Complete texts (info)")`

Returns: 
```
  id: 1633,
  heading: "Complete texts (info)",
  sortid: "51633.5",
  parentid: "2870.5",
  path: "info/GG",
  id: 1684,
  heading: "Complete texts (info)",
  sortid: "51684.5",
  parentid: "51682.5",
  path: "info/KK",
  id: 1773,
  heading: "Complete texts (info)",
  sortid: "51773.5",
  parentid: "51771.5",
  path: "info/NN",
```

princeton_ansible.title: first draft of CDH error handling

comments.body:
@rlskoeser thanks for the review - I updated the branch in light of your comments. The current changes:
- add the CDH logo and properly reference it
- reinstate the PUL logo above the CDH one
- keep the lsupport link
- leave 404 and 500 errors out of the CDH-errors.conf list - I hope that this will preserve the application's custom pages for those errors, but I have not tested this
- leave production site configs unchanged

I do not know of a way to differentiate 403 errors by cause, but we could experiment - is there a staging site that needs this special handling?

Thanks for the revisions!

I've been thinking about how to test this; I can add logic to force a 500 error on a staging site, so we can easily check 404 and 500 behavior. We can think about how to trigger other errors for testing purposes (e.g., shutting down nginx on the app server).  

I'll have to check the application code bases to find out which ones use or generate any other error codes besides these two. Once I have that list, I should be able to figure out how we can test them.

> I do not know of a way to differentiate 403 errors by cause, but we could experiment - is there a staging site that needs this special handling?

I think a 403 is possible in an internal API used for annotations in the Geniza code base; we'd want the user to see the error message if they're not on vpn but get the app-specific 403 if they are on vpn. I'll think about how to test this when I look for specifics for possible error codes.

tiger-data-app.title: How do we tie the tigerdata user to the actions being taken in Mediaflux
create_collection_asset does not seem to be working

comments.body:
The initial idea was to use a namespace for the organization (e.g. `rc` in the example above) and a collection asset for the project (e.g. `test-2` in the example) but THEN we changed it to have a namespace in between the organization and the project (hence the `test-2-ns`) and that's probably when it broke.

I do not remember why we decided to add the second namespace (`test-2-ns`) in between the two. I think we thought a single namespace for an organization might become too big for certain organizations and hence we played it safe and created one namespace per project (in addition to one collection asset per project)
More information about this: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1G8yjEGOdiTtwrScgR8jwNQ7Cvl9BIR53OLPrEO5MrtY/edit#heading=h.q6jrx6d9muf9
